content:
• Friday, November 11, 2011
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -0.7%) closed its first full week of trading on a down note. Options trading will...

    Groupon (GRPN -0.7%) closed its first full week of trading on a down note. Options trading will commence on Monday, giving the many investors who have shorted the daily deals giant a chance to buy puts at strike prices from $15 to $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • HOG

    A Harley-Davidson (HOG +4.9%) dealer in St. Paul, Minnesota is suing the motorcycle maker in...

    A Harley-Davidson (HOG +4.9%) dealer in St. Paul, Minnesota is suing the motorcycle maker in federal court. The lawsuit claims the company's restrictions on international sales by U.S. dealers and sales through third-party websites are unfair, and illegally alter the company's franchise agreement with dealers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • UAL

    United Airlines (UAL +4%) says it's reached a tentative agreement on a labor contract with its...

    United Airlines (UAL +4%) says it's reached a tentative agreement on a labor contract with its mechanics union. The agreement covers approximately 5,500 United mechanics and related employees located throughout the United States.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • HBPC

    Helix BioPharma (HBP -3.6%) falls after saying the clinical hold on its new drug application for...

    Helix BioPharma (HBP -3.6%) falls after saying the clinical hold on its new drug application for its cervical lesion drug trial has been removed by the FDA, however the company still lacks the funding to start the trial.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • DIS

    Hold the pixie dust for a minute. Although Walt Disney (DIS +6.1%) continues to pace S&P...

    Hold the pixie dust for a minute. Although Walt Disney (DIS +6.1%) continues to pace S&P gainers after the company beat expectations for its FQ4, Goldman Sachs analyst Drew Borst thinks theme park revenue growth may begin to tail off: “In the current quarter, room reservations are flat Y/Y, and room rates are up low single digits, now that prices have normalized." (earlier: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • GHC

    Shares of The Washington Post (WPO +2%) are trading higher, despite Moody's downgrading the...

    Shares of The Washington Post (WPO +2%) are trading higher, despite Moody's downgrading the media chain's debt rating to A3 from A2. The agency also cut its commercial paper to Prime-2 from Prime-1.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • DIS

    Disney's (DIS +6.3%) FQ3 beat, headlined by the strong performance of its Media Networks...

    Disney's (DIS +6.3%) FQ3 beat, headlined by the strong performance of its Media Networks business, is giving a lift to other TV network owners. CBS +4.9%. TWX +3%. DISCA +2.9%. AMCX +6.9%. SNI +3.8%. VIA.B +3.4%. LSTZA +7.4%. (DIS transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • DDS

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) remains under heavy downward pressure after its Q3 revenue miss kickstarted...

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) remains under heavy downward pressure after its Q3 revenue miss kickstarted selling. Shares are now down 13.9%, as option traders pile on with sizeable bearish bets on the retailer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • DDS

    Dillard's (DDS -14.2%) shares continue their selloff after negative reaction to its Q3 results,...

    Dillard's (DDS -14.2%) shares continue their selloff after negative reaction to its Q3 results, despite an 85% Y/Y profit jump. Overhead costs rose 1.6% while same-store sales rose 5%, a narrower outperformance than in Q2. JPMorgan calls it a "red flag" which should narrow further with tougher top-line and gross margin comparisons in Q4 making it harder for Dillard's to keep logging solid growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • NST

    NSTAR (NST +2%) moves higher after getting upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo. Wells says it...

    NSTAR (NST +2%) moves higher after getting upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo. Wells says it expects the company's merger with Northeast Utilities to close in H1 2012, and give a boost to revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • DYN

    A group of Dynegy Holdings (NYSE:DYN) lease bondholders asks a judge to appoint an examiner to...

    A group of Dynegy Holdings (NYSE:DYN) lease bondholders asks a judge to appoint an examiner to investigate the series of unusual transactions leading up to the power generator's bankruptcy filing, potentially threatening to derail the reorganization. But prices have been rising on Dynegy bonds, suggesting that at least some bondholders are OK with the arrangement.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • CAG

    ConAgra Foods (CAG -1.6%) lags the overall market after getting cut to Neutral from Buy at UBS,...

    ConAgra Foods (CAG -1.6%) lags the overall market after getting cut to Neutral from Buy at UBS, citing weak core demand and slowing volumes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • MSCC

    Analog chipmaker Microsemi (MSCC +4.4%) rises after reporting FQ4 revenue of $227.3M (+50% Y/Y)...

    Analog chipmaker Microsemi (MSCC +4.4%) rises after reporting FQ4 revenue of $227.3M (+50% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.52; the former beat by $0.9M, while the latter was in-line. Thanks to the impact of the Zarlink acquisition, as well as Thai flooding, Microsemi is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $238M-$246M ($226.7M consensus) and EPS of $0.38-$0.42 ($0.52 consensus). (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME -7%) gets hit after Wedbush cuts the shares to Neutral, citing concern...

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME -7%) gets hit after Wedbush cuts the shares to Neutral, citing concern over continued delays in the Phase 3 trials for oral Vernakalant by its partner Merck.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • CAR

    Avis Budget (CAR +5.1%) outperforms after Goldman lifts its estimates and PT for the car rental...

    Avis Budget (CAR +5.1%) outperforms after Goldman lifts its estimates and PT for the car rental provider. The firm expects Avis, which fell last week following its Q3 report, to move higher thanks to a combination of rental volume growth, improving margins, and the potential for synergies from its acquisition of Avis Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (NASDAQ:BRLI) announces a 1M share stock buyback program to run...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (NASDAQ:BRLI) announces a 1M share stock buyback program to run through Oct. 31 of next year after shares cratered on corruption allegations. Shares are now down 20.7% after bottoming out at a 52-week low of $11.41 earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • ACTV

    Active Network (NYSE:ACTV), a provider of online event management services, gains 13.1% after...

    Active Network (NYSE:ACTV), a provider of online event management services, gains 13.1% after reporting Q3 revenue of $89.7M (+23% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.03, beating Street estimates by $3.9M and $0.01. Net event registrations rose 15% Y/Y to $23.5M, while revenue per registration rose 2% to $2.59. The company expects Q4 revenue of $72M-$76M, above a $70.8M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • ETFC

    E-Trade (ETFC -4.2%) couldn't swing a deal because it would have required a buyer to take on the...

    E-Trade (ETFC -4.2%) couldn't swing a deal because it would have required a buyer to take on the company’s legacy loan portfolio, which should be valued ~$1.3B less than than the figure on its books, Raymond James says. The key question now is whether Ken Griffin’s hedge fund will sell its remaining 9.6% stake or re-engage ETFC in an activist role.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALGT

    Allegiant Travel (ALGT +3.8%) gets a pop from an upgrade by Ticonderoga to Buy with a $60 price...

    Allegiant Travel (ALGT +3.8%) gets a pop from an upgrade by Ticonderoga to Buy with a $60 price target. Ticonderoga notes the travel company's improved operating outlook and reduction in non-fuel unit costs. Separately, UBS ups its price target to $63.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +3.5%) is now rallying following a morning plunge. Commentary on the company's FQ3...

    Nvidia (NVDA +3.5%) is now rallying following a morning plunge. Commentary on the company's FQ3 report (I, II) has focused heavily on its Tegra mobile processor chips. Raymond James (Strong Buy) is happy with the design win pace for Tegra 3 chips, while MKM (Neutral) is concerned about the loss of Motorola as a customer, as well as AMZN's decision to go with TXN for the Kindle Fire. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • QSR

    Tim Hortons (THI +4.2%) gains on an upgrade to buy from Desjardins, citing the company's...

    Tim Hortons (THI +4.2%) gains on an upgrade to buy from Desjardins, citing the company's postitive Q3 momentum.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALIM

    Shares of Alimera Sciences (ALIM -72%) are crushed after the FDA fails to approve its Iluvien...

    Shares of Alimera Sciences (ALIM -72%) are crushed after the FDA fails to approve its Iluvien drug for the treatment of diabetic macular edema, stating that the risks of adverse reactions were "significant." Alimera will need to conduct two additional clinical trials to demonstrate that the product is safe and effective. Shares of Iluvien licensee pSivida (PSDV -54%) also sink.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON +2.2%) gains on positive comments out of Piper Jaffray this morning.  Piper...

    Monsanto (MON +2.2%) gains on positive comments out of Piper Jaffray this morning.  Piper says it’s more confident in its Overweight rating following the company's analyst day, and that Latin America represents a multi-year growth opportunity for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett (BBG +5.5%) gets a boost from a Goldman upgrade to Neutral. Goldman says the stock...

    Bill Barrett (BBG +5.5%) gets a boost from a Goldman upgrade to Neutral. Goldman says the stock has better upside potential versus its peers, and is likely to see sustained drilling success at its Uteland Butte oil and gas field and other formations in Utah's Uinta Basin.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM

  • The Swiss franc dives against both the euro and greenback after the SNB's Jean-Pierre Danthine...

    The Swiss franc dives against both the euro and greenback after the SNB's Jean-Pierre Danthine hits the wires saying the back is prepared to take further measures to weaken the currency. Chatter abounds the SNB is to move the euro/franc floor from  CHF 1.20 to CHF 1.30. The euro currently buys CHF 1.24, +0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) pare back earlier strong gains, now up only 2.8%, after...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) pare back earlier strong gains, now up only 2.8%, after a report tips the firm denies Liberty Media (LCAPA +2.3%) is making a play to buy the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • TPGI

    Thomas Properties Group (TPGI +6.2%) gains after announcing it's leased a large space in its One...

    Thomas Properties Group (TPGI +6.2%) gains after announcing it's leased a large space in its One Commerce Square building in Philadelphia to tax advisory firm Ernst & Young.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC +5.8%) gains on a Jefferies upgrade to Buy. Jefferies says the...

    Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC +5.8%) gains on a Jefferies upgrade to Buy. Jefferies says the company's restructuring is giving a boost to margins, and recent channel checks show it's capturing greater market share.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • EQIX

    Equinix (EQIX +6.3%) pops after JP Morgan initiates the stock with an Overweight, saying the...

    Equinix (EQIX +6.3%) pops after JP Morgan initiates the stock with an Overweight, saying the company is at the intersection of several big trends in the data center industry. Demand for the company's data center solutions is being spurred by several large trends including enterprises moving more content to both private and public clouds and more users accessing the Internet from mobile and smart phones.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +8.9%) shares soar to three-month highs on speculation that Liberty...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +8.9%) shares soar to three-month highs on speculation that Liberty Media (LCAPA +2.5%) may buy the rest of the company. Liberty may be setting up a $1.5B credit facility to help fund a purchase of the bookstore chain, Phoenix Partners analyst Robert Routh says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • HGG

    HHGregg (HGG +2.2%) moves up after saying it will open its doors at midnight Thanksgiving night...

    HHGregg (HGG +2.2%) moves up after saying it will open its doors at midnight Thanksgiving night and stay open through 9 p.m. during "Black Friday," the biggest shopping day of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth Financial (GNW +6.3%) jumps after Citigroup ups the shares to Neutral, citing the...

    Genworth Financial (GNW +6.3%) jumps after Citigroup ups the shares to Neutral, citing the company's plan to sell a 40% stake of its Australian mortgage-insurance business through an IPO next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI -24.7%) nosedives following a scathing column from...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI -24.7%) nosedives following a scathing column from TheStreetSweeper, alleging (among other things) a "culture of corruption" and ties to organized crime. It doesn't help that Jefferies is responding by putting its Hold rating under review, believing TheStreetSweeper's report could lead to regulatory scrutiny.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SYK

    Stryker (SYK +2.4%) moves up after saying it plans to shed around 5% of its global work force by...

    Stryker (SYK +2.4%) moves up after saying it plans to shed around 5% of its global work force by 2013 in response to sector-wide challenges and a new tax on medical-device makers.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • SREV

    Customer management software maker ServiceSource (SREV +9.5%) jumps after raising its full-year...

    Customer management software maker ServiceSource (SREV +9.5%) jumps after raising its full-year revenue outlook for a third time since going public in March. Oppenheimer notes following SREV's positive pre-announcement last month, it delivered even stronger than expected Q3 results: revenue of $50.1M, up 31% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • BONT

    Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -1%) dips after S&P lowers its outlook on the department store...

    Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -1%) dips after S&P lowers its outlook on the department store operator to negative, citing merchandising problems, higher raw material prices, and weak consumer spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (TI +6.7%) rallies after reporting Q3 revenue of €7.52B (+13% Y/Y) and net...

    Telecom Italia (TI +6.7%) rallies after reporting Q3 revenue of €7.52B (+13% Y/Y) and net profit of €807M, beating a consensus of €7.48B and €608M. Healthy growth in the telco's Brazilian and Argentine operations helped offset a 4% decline in Italian revenues. Like its government, Telecom Italia is saddled with a high debt load, which is expected to amount to €30.7B at year's end. (PR - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +3.6%) moves higher after reporting its October traffic rose 14% Y/Y,...

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +3.6%) moves higher after reporting its October traffic rose 14% Y/Y, boosted by higher metals shipments and a series of recent acquisitions. Same-railroad traffic for the month increased 2.4% year-over-year, excluding carloads from the company's FreightLink Acquisition and Arizona Eastern Railway.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Even after shares shed 39% yesterday and 63% since September, Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +5.8%)...

    Even after shares shed 39% yesterday and 63% since September, Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +5.8%) is still nearly twice as expensive for potential acquirers as the median S&P 500 company. Analysts say potential buyers would risk overpaying for a firm that faces competition, as patents on its brewing system expire in less than a year, and scrutiny of its accounting practices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 4 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -11.4%) continues moving lower after missing Q3 estimates and lowering its 2011...

    Molycorp (MCP -11.4%) continues moving lower after missing Q3 estimates and lowering its 2011 production forecasts. JPMorgan (Neutral) is lowering its PT in response, arguing rare earth prices could fall some more in 2011 before new Chinese export controls arrive, and supply increases from Molycorp and Australia's Lynas could also hurt prices. REE is down 3.9% in sympathy. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • GWW

    W.W. Grainger (GWW +1.9%) moves up after reporting its October daily sales rose 16% Y/Y, due in...

    W.W. Grainger (GWW +1.9%) moves up after reporting its October daily sales rose 16% Y/Y, due in part to recent acquisitions. U.S. sales, which account for most of the company's top line, rose 9%, Canada climbed 16%, while other businesses, which include the recently acquired Fabory Group, more than doubled.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • DIS

    Hotel stocks show strength with outperforming gains across the board. A slightly improved...

    Hotel stocks show strength with outperforming gains across the board. A slightly improved outlook on consumer spending and Disney's (DIS +7.1%) strong parks performance are helping tip sentiment. Advancers: HOT +3.9%, MAR +3.8%, GET +4.4%, H +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • STRA

    Strayer Education (STRA +3.6%) moves up after acquiring Jack Welsh Management Institute, an...

    Strayer Education (STRA +3.6%) moves up after acquiring Jack Welsh Management Institute, an online business and executive education program based on the management principals of former General Electric CEO Jack Welsh. Financial terms aren't disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • DDS

    Dillard's (DDS -7.9%) takes a hit after its Q3 revenue misses estimates, despite an 85% Y/Y jump...

    Dillard's (DDS -7.9%) takes a hit after its Q3 revenue misses estimates, despite an 85% Y/Y jump in profit and a 6% jump in same-store sales. Gross margins also edged slightly higher to 36.4%, but not enough to impress after the company agressively cut costs, closed stores and reduced inventory to improve performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • CBK

    Shares of Christopher & Banks (CBK +6.3%) are on the rise after the women's apparel retailer...

    Shares of Christopher & Banks (CBK +6.3%) are on the rise after the women's apparel retailer announces cost-cutting steps: It will close about 100 of its 761 stores, accelerate plans to convert or consolidate existing locations into dual-format stores, and cut 7% of its corporate staff and 13% of its store operations field management team.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • AL

    Air Lease (AL -1.8%) falls off after posting an earnings beat last night. CEO Steven Udvar-Hazy...

    Air Lease (AL -1.8%) falls off after posting an earnings beat last night. CEO Steven Udvar-Hazy strikes an upbeat tone in an earnings CC, reiterating that demand for new aircraft is outstripping supply and global factors will drive airlines toward leasing solutions. "We do not see signs of airlines throttling back on their demand for new aircraft."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • AMCX

    Shares of AMC Networks (AMCX +6.2%) post a solid gain, extending yesterday's post-earnings...

    Shares of AMC Networks (AMCX +6.2%) post a solid gain, extending yesterday's post-earnings report rally. The company landed an upgrade from Stifel Nicolaus to Hold from Sell, while Morningstar calls shares "fairly valued" on overhyped acquisition talks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • NVDA

    For the second straight quarter (previously), Nvidia (NVDA -1%) is selling off after initially...

    For the second straight quarter (previously), Nvidia (NVDA -1%) is selling off after initially rising post-earnings. While FQ3 numbers were solid (I, II), the chipmaker's FQ4 guidance was less so. CC comments about a 4% Q/Q decline in notebook chip sales, along with a forecast of flat notebook chip sales in FQ4, is likely adding to fears of market share loss at the hands of Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Sandy Bridge and AMD's Llano.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • HMIN

    Home Inns & Motels (HMIN +6.5%) trades higher after the firm says it expects revenue in Q4...

    Home Inns & Motels (HMIN +6.5%) trades higher after the firm says it expects revenue in Q4 to fall in a range of $156M-$159.1M, up from prior guidance. The Chinese economy hotel chain busted through the estimates of analysts for Q3 revenue, posting $154.9M vs. consensus $142.1.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • SBSAA

    Shares of microcap media company Spanish Broadcasting System (SBSA +58.1%) skyrocket after the...

    Shares of microcap media company Spanish Broadcasting System (SBSA +58.1%) skyrocket after the reports Q3 revenue gains Y/Y and Q/Q. Even more importantly, the firm's market cap pushed north of $15M which will help in its bid to stave off a Nasdaq delisting.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • PWR

    Energy contractor Quanta Services (NYSE:PWR), which fell yesterday on the State Department's...

    Energy contractor Quanta Services (NYSE:PWR), which fell yesterday on the State Department's decision to delay the Keystone oil pipeline, is down another 2.6% this morning after Wedbush removes the company from its Best Ideas list (albeit while maintaining an Outperform). The firm argues the Keystone delay will "reduce the magnitude of upside to 2012 EPS estimates."
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • DIS

    Shares of Disney (NYSE:DIS) gain strength in premarket trading, up 4.1%, as analysts start to...

    Shares of Disney (NYSE:DIS) gain strength in premarket trading, up 4.1%, as analysts start to weigh in on both sides of the fence on the company's FQ4 earnings beat. Though Janney's Tony Wible likes the company's prospects in parks, TV networks, cruise ships and other areas - he clips his PT on shares to $40 as he warns a sluggish economy could drag down results.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT), a maker of high-end Wi-Fi networking gear, is up 10.2% after...

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT), a maker of high-end Wi-Fi networking gear, is up 10.2% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $79.2M (+132% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.23. Growth was boosted by strong sales of the company's AirMax base stations and antennas. Ubiquiti, which went public last month, is guiding for FQ2 revenue of $83M-$86M and EPS of $0.24-$0.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (NASDAQ:SODA), which shot higher on Wednesday on a Q3 beat, is up 1.8% premarket...

    Sodastream (NASDAQ:SODA), which shot higher on Wednesday on a Q3 beat, is up 1.8% premarket after Deutsche reiterates a Buy. While concerned about weak Q3 growth in canister exchanges and soda flavor sales, as well as a soft gross margin, Deutsche believes growing U.S. household penetration, fueled by expanded retail distribution, will drive shares higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM
  • OPK

    Shares of Opko Health (NYSEMKT:OPK) rack up a 5.7% gain premarket after Jefferies initiates...

    Shares of Opko Health (NYSEMKT:OPK) rack up a 5.7% gain premarket after Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $8 price target. Analysts point to the firm's diversified portfolio as a driver for "significant upside opportunities."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM

  • EU shares are higher in early trading on political progress in Greece and Italy, the latter's...

    EU shares are higher in early trading on political progress in Greece and Italy, the latter's non-disastrous debt auction yesterday, supportive U.S. economic data, and a decent Q3 earnings season. Stoxx 50 +0.8%, Germany +0.8%, Italy +1.4%, France +0.8%, Spain +0.6%, U.K. +0.5%, Greece +0.4%. Euro +0.7% to $1.3623.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 AM
